DataElement.preferredName: Permanent Dental Restoration Therapy Plaque Dental Calculus White Spot Lesion Administration Depth Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The application of a restoration which is designed to remain in place for a long time and seal the tooth on which there is a film attached to it, causing dental caries and gingivitis and the presence of an abnormal concretion or calcified deposit that is formed around the tooth with class V white spot lesions in a 30-year female old patient with no missing teeth._A code that describes the depth of a caries.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Permanent Dental Restoration Therapy Plaque Dental Calculus White Spot Lesion Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The application of a restoration which is designed to remain in place for a long time and seal the tooth on which there is a film attached to it, causing dental caries and gingivitis and the presence of an abnormal concretion or calcified deposit that is formed around the tooth with class V white spot lesions in a 30-year female old patient with no missing teeth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A replacement for a lost tooth structure designed for continued or prolonged use.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A replacement for a lost tooth structure designed for continued or prolonged use.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Plaque Dental Calculus White Spot Lesion Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: A biofilm that contains numerous microorganisms that adheres to the teeth.:Mineralized deposit that forms on the teeth or dental prostheses:A chalky white area that appears on a tooth surface indicating the presence of decalcified enamel and the potential to advance to cavitation.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: A biofilm that contains numerous microorganisms that adheres to the teeth.
Mineralized deposit that forms on the teeth or dental prostheses.
A chalky white area that appears on a tooth surface indicating the presence of decalcified enamel and the potential to advance to cavitation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A code that describes the depth of a caries.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Caries is still confined to the outer 1/2 of the enamel of the tooth

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Caries is still confined to the outer 1/2 of the enamel of the tooth
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caries is still confined to the outer 1/2 of the enamel of the tooth

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Caries is in the inner of the enamel and approaching the outer layer of dentin.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Caries is in the inner of the enamel and approaching the outer layer of dentin.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caries is in the inner of the enamel and approaching the outer layer of dentin.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.5.20 mc

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Caries is past the enamel and in the outer 1/3 of the dentin

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caries is past the enamel and in the outer 1/3 of the dentin

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Caries is in the middle 1/3 of the dentin

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Caries is in the middle 1/3 of the dentin
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caries is in the middle 1/3 of the dentin

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Caries is in the inner 1/3 of the dentin (D3) and approaching the nerve.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Caries is in the inner 1/3 of the dentin (D3) and approaching the nerve.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Caries is in the inner 1/3 of the dentin (D3) and approaching the nerve.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.:Depth; extent downward or inward.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
